@Patniniadh1eguk @DonaldClarke63 I see a lot of Roger Corman Concorde Anois classics ending up in that list 🙃But leave Bloodfist VIII: Trained to Kill out of it, that's a contemporary classic of the Don "The Dragon" Wilson oeuvre and I won't hear bad things against it! Wayne
@DonaldClarke63 Shocking lack of Taffin in there, Donald! And no love for The Courier?! 😄 Numbers 1, 2, and 7 are among our crowning achievements though. 🙏 Wayne
https://t.co/JItPCp4lJs Nice to be Number 1 in the recommended film books of 2020 category for my new book, Nick Mclean Behind The Camera 🙏Wayne https://t.co/sWtHo2TJT3

@conorsmurf I miss VHS culture. My film education (and education in general) came from the video shops I spent my youth in. As someone who hated school and sports, video shops where my world. Just perusing the shelves, picking up and looking at the covers is a pleasure that I miss. Wayne
@mattzollerseitz My deepest sympathies, Matt. So sorry for your loss. Wayne
@joshgad @YouTube Ah, looks like I was too late to the party. It was already on. Oh well. If there's ever a Goonies Re-United Apart Part 2... :-) Wayne

@joshgad @YouTube Hey Josh, have you contacted Goonies cinematographer (and actor - Mouth's dad) Nick McLean for this? I know he would love to be part of it. He tells some awesome stories from working on it. He's a good friend of mine, if you'd like me to put you in touch. Wayne
@DonaldClarke63 Same here, orchestra not for me. I'd rather throw on the albums. Wayne
@VexedRed Absolutely madness. The same as all these places opening up again, absolutely ridiculous, putting service workers lives at risk. W
@JayCoyle Break into crumbs and sprinkle over a streak and grill...amazing! Wayne

@DonaldClarke63 Bruce Springsteen over here. Though it was very nearly Radiohead... phew, thank fook it was Bruce. I couldn't imagine being quarantined with the 'head! Although I'm sure they're lovely chaps 😊 Wayne

@adlow76 Nothing new re credibility. There was article that came out in it a while back suggesting Tarantino had no time for woman in his work. Considering a third of his films are centred on and named after women -and  I'm no big fan of Tarantino's work - I'd say they are wrong. W

Very proud of my new book-the memoir of my friend & co-author, Nick Mclean @McFarlandCoPub #Cobra #OverTheTop @TheSlyStallone @CannonFilms @FriendsTV #cinematography #TheGoonies @cyndilauper @SeanAstin @Jeff_B_Cohen #TheRose @BetteMidler #shortcircuit @SteveGuttbuck @allysheedy1 https://t.co/PmgU2gSqzo

I wrote an article for today's Irish Times, all about my dear friend Nick McLean and our new book which we wrote together on his amazing life and career in Hollywood. Catch the article in today's paper, or online below. 🙏 Wayne https://t.co/1bycHvvxxl
@marymagjoan I'm very proud of that spread Mary. Can't wait to see it in today's paper 😊🙏 W
@IFI_Dub I had to seize upon the rare opporuntiy to herald a Burt Reynolds movie in a discussion of Irish animation 😁Wayne
@IFI_Dub Does All Dogs go to Heaven count? Made here at Sullivan-Bluth on the Conyngham Road back about '89 😃 Wayne
@DonaldClarke63 Lunch? Lynch perhaps. Damn predukter text. W

@DonaldClarke63 There was something subtely soothing about Lynch relating his routine of coffee, meditation and work not being changed by the crisis. The idea that Lunch is here and doing his thing, in perhaps his own spiritual way, is reassuring Thankfully un-paranoid and non-apocalyptic. W

@philipnolan1 @SheridansCheese @StTolaCheese The Reblochon from Sheridans is perhaps cheese at its absolute finest. I did the cheese and wine evening yesterday, so waiting for Lamb Saag and Kirihil Shiraz to arrive right now. Enojy, Philip! Wayne
@jenTCM @tcm @Home2Hollywood lol, wise move Jennifer, although I was eight when I first saw it! Keep the Burt magic going though and introduce her to All Dogs go to Heaven :-) Wayne
@marymagjoan Absolutely! I'm looking forward to this beautiful marriage of beef and stout 😀W
@marymagjoan Oh God, I have a craving on me now after seeing that photo! I've got Bovril in the press but no Guinness ☹️ I'll rectify that tomorrow 😊 W
@caroldecker My favourite line: "as a youth, I used to weep in butcher's shops..." 🤣🤣 Wayne
@McFarlandCoPub Brilliant! Always thought there should be a book-length study of the various IT texts. Can't wait to read this! Wayne
@CarolineAuthor You look great, Caroline, like an old time starlet in that 😊
@workshedpod Ah, I see it now. It's a MeAt20 thing. W

@workshedpod Well, you look good and healthy these days man! I've noticed a good few people posting old pics, is this a thing I missed? Is it specifically when you are 20 that people post? Not that I have many, if any even, from back then. W
@workshedpod No way! Jesus lad, you look younger these days! 😁 Wayne

A wonderful review of my new book, Nick McLean Behind the Camers, which is the Hollywood memoir of the legendary cinematographer, co-written with Nick himself. 🙏 @FilmIreland @kildarelibrary @IrishLitTimes @McFarlandCoPub @booksirelandmag @IrishTimesCultr @IrishTimesBooks Wayne https://t.co/qMRbZXfm6p
@m77oz Get Carter! Wayne

@Ushabye @RTE_Culture @IFI_Dub @ABFalecbaldwin Interesting to look back on. I visited Wexford around 1990 and Robocop was playing. Was already on VHS and on then-new Sky Movies at that point. I remember it felt like Teen Wolf was barely out of the cinema when Teen Wolf Too arrived. Which was great because I loved them Wayne

@Ushabye @RTE_Culture @IFI_Dub @ABFalecbaldwin I was going through Irish newspapers from the 80s in work today looking for stuff like this. It confirmed my memory of films strangely coming out here late. A Nightmare on Elm Street 2 ('85), Teen Wolf ('85), and Crocodile Dundee ('86) all released to cinemas here in 1987. Wayne

Get 20% off my two contributions to pop-culture literature (Burt Reynolds on Screen and Nick Mclean Behind the Camera) and many more at McFarland. Use the coupon code PCA20 to avail of this great offer. Wayne https://t.co/gSohoOCBiv https://t.co/r4C1OYN3UE

@DonaldClarke63 Anything by Wes Anderson, but for the sake of choosing one I will say The Royal Tenenbaums. Few directors have the ability to irritate me as much. Something so self-consciously smug about his films, populated with hideous characters. Wayne

@DonaldClarke63 Jaysus, that sounds skin-crawlingly bad. I watched Four Weddings again recently, hard to see what all the fuss was about back in 95. I remember it being the first video we had to ever pre-order in our local video shop. W
"Looking for Love" by someone who sounds suspiciously like John Waite. From the great Blue Jean Cop (aka Shakedown) from 1988. Wayne https://t.co/cDqft8BXJU
@cassianelwes That's a book I'd buy! 😊 Wayne
@lettermonkey One of the great action films. W

@lettermonkey Oh man, Extreme Prejudice! One of the best. My friend Mike was the Camera Operator on that. The closest thing any contemporary film could come to The Wild Bunch. 🙏 My favourite Walter Hill movie. Wayne
@LangenkampH Hi Heather, I'm trying to get in touch in regard to a book. Can you DM me or let me know where to officially get in touch? Thank you. Wayne
@NaasBall @CoKildare @Foregolfcustom 🙃😀Time for bed, Ball! You've had enough of that good stuff! W
@caroldecker Looks like a lovely time right there! Good grub, a sup, and great movie. Enjoy! Wayne
@NaasBall @CoKildare @Foregolfcustom Damn, I nearly got through the whole day without a sup...I may have one now after seeing this! :-) Wayne
@john_boyne So is this why The Heart's Invisible Furies is going cheap? No need for royalties anymore after this lady's kindness anyway 😉😅 W

@DonaldClarke63 This (MUBI selections) is kind of like some reputable labels & their dubious catalogue. At a certain point you have to say, "no, sorry [insert boutique label..okay it's Criterion], but no matter how many academics provide audio commentary, Armageddon is still unholy shite!" Wayne
@JMaguireCritic This is infinitely better than Netflix!  Nice find! Wayne
@DonaldClarke63 This person has a PhD?? 🤔 Whatever institution accredited those letters to her may need to reconsider or go out back and have talk to themselves. W
@DonCoscarelli @AMichaelBaldwin Happy Birthday, Michael! Thanks to you, and Don, for making Phantasm a very special horror film and for entertaining us so much. Wayne
@philipnolan1 Let the freak flags fly! The poor oul mirrors won't be getting as much attention as usual, people will be like vampires to a cross when they come across one 🙃W
@john_boyne Earth to Jaysus, won't someone please think of the children! 🙃 Wayne

@sheilaoflanagan @DonaldClarke63 I've seen dodgy links to my books before they were finished and turned in to my publisher 😅 you think you're downloading Burt Reynolds on Screen, but you might actually get something of ill repute or something of higher literary calibre...but not Burt Reynolds on Screen! Wayne

@DonaldClarke63 People wouldnt walk into a shop and lift a paper, so it shouldn't it be any different online. The content should be paid for, both the content provider/journalist and the paper/publisher. Work should be paid for, simple as that. Words are financially undervalued. Wayne

@DonaldClarke63 Considering the amount of films he watches, it kind of makes sense. But there's no way I could go 3 months without watching Cop and a Half...no chance! I jest, but some films do need to be seen more than once. Certain films make more sense at different times in our lives. Wayne
@maxcaulfield I'll be celebrating, my friend! 😉🍷🙏 Hope you, Juliet, and Melissa are all keeping safe and well x Wayne https://t.co/tztg2v6rp7

@stuartclark66 I never shared more than a head nod with him when I started reviewing movies. But we always sat close to each other & I always enjoyed hearing his opinions. He was a great writer. Always remember his piece in The Herald on seeing REM in the RDS in '89. So passionate. Wayne
@disneyplus How about including the adult Touchstone films (D.O.A, An Innocent Man, Stakeout, etc), rather than just the children's stuff? That would be great! Wayne
@philipnolan1 Looks fantastic...except for the tomato! 🙃 Enjoy!

@Wm_Sadler Keeping well, Bill! My new book came out this week (DP Nick McLean's Hollywood memoir), but tomorrow I start work with a community helpdesk to aid vulnerable & elderly people during this crisis. Watched Tresspass again, one of Walter Hill's best & you were great! Keep safe! Wayne

@Josh_Merritt1 @ArrowFilmsVideo @101_Films @88_Films @ShoutFactory No I'm in Ireland. I have a multi-region player that I use for certain discs. You can get some European versions of Body Bags on Amazon. Whether they are cut or uncut, I'm not sure. W

@Josh_Merritt1 Absolutely man, they are pricey! After a while you might pick them up cheap on Amazon. I really appreciate the retweet. Atkins is king! Maniac Cop, Night of the Creeps, Lethal Weapon. Brilliant! W

@Josh_Merritt1 @ArrowFilmsVideo @101_Films @88_Films I got it @ShoutFactory and I got an older Artisan DVD release, which is unforunately cut. But the Shout Factory edition is uncut and widescreen. Beautiful. W

@Josh_Merritt1 I just found a link which covers them both - https://t.co/gpUNavDkgj - thank you, sir! And some more honourable lockdown viewing recommendatios: anything John Carpenter, plus one of my all-time favourite films, Halloween 3: Season of the Witch. I can watch that any day. Wayne

@Josh_Merritt1 @ArrowFilmsVideo @101_Films @88_Films Haha, I have a TV set, but no channels or streaming services. SC1 is very hard to get; I've an old Anchor Bay copy. I recently picked up Bloodsucking Pharaohs in Pittsburgh and Hollywood Chainsaw Hookers, & one of my favourite films, Body Bags (by John Carpenter & Tobe Hooper) W

@Josh_Merritt1 Sure thing! Wow, thanks Josh! 😀 https://t.co/2KjNdnLbU7 and https://t.co/tkkyN37Cqf They're available from all major book stores, but those links are to my publisher. Cheers dude! I appreciate the retweet! Wayne

@Josh_Merritt1 I love those movies and have them on blu-ray. I don't have TV and I don't do streaming. I'm a big VHS, DVD, and Blu Ray collector. And it is a golden age for horror on physical media right now thanks to @ArrowFilmsVideo @101_Films @88_Films . Amazing time to be a fan. Wayne

@Josh_Merritt1 They are Burt Reynolds on Screen and Nick McLean Behind the Camera: The Life and Works of Hollywood Cinematographer. The latter out this week. It's his memoir that I co-wrote. He is a legend, responsible for some of the greatest images of last 50 years of US cinema and TV. :-) W
